entry.title: So you want to be a wizard
entry.summary:
Description

I don't always feel like a wizard. I'm not the most experienced member on my team, like most people I sometimes find my work difficult, and I still have a TON TO LEARN.

But along the way, I have learned a few ways to debug tricky problems, get the information I need from my colleagues, and get my job done.

Montréal-Python 67: Ultramodern Vintage - PyCon Canada Special https://montrealpython.org/2017/10/mp67/

entry.title: Systems programming as a swiss army knife
entry.summary:
Description

Montreal, March 16th, 2015, by Julia Evans - You might think of the Linux kernel as something that only kernel developers need to know about. Not so! It turns out that understanding some basics about kernels and systems programming makes you a better developer, and you can use this knowledge when debugging your normal everyday Python programs.

  • Contact Julia: https://twitter.com/b0rk
  • MP52: http://sflx.ca/mp52
  • Montreal Python: http://montrealpython.org
  • Savoir-faire Linux: http://sflx.ca/jobs

As seen at PyCon 2015: https://us.pycon.org/2015/schedule/presentation/363/

entry.title: Easy network hacking with scapy
entry.summary:
Description

Montreal, June 9, 2014 - Julia Evans presents scapy, a powerful interactive packet manipulation program that is able to forge or decode packets of a wide number of protocols, send them, capture them, match requests and replies, and much more.

Useful links:

  • Julia: @b0rk
  • scapy: http://sflx.ca/scapy
  • MP47: http://sflx.ca/mp47e
  • Montreal Python: http://montrealpython.org
  • Savoir-faire Linux: http://www.savoirfairelinux.com

entry.title: Diving into Open Data with IPython Notebook & Pandas
entry.summary:
Description

A live presentation by Julia Evans.

Read more: http://sflx.ca/mp39

entry.title: Intro to Pandas with IPython notebook
How to Trick a Neural Network
entry.summary:
Description

PyData Berlin 2016

Slides: http://jvns.ca/blog/2016/05/21/a-few-notes-from-my-pydata-berlin-keynote/

www.pydata.org

PyData is a gathering of users and developers of data analysis tools in Python. The goals are to provide Python enthusiasts a place to share ideas and learn from each other about how best to apply our language and tools to ever-evolving challenges in the vast realm of data management, processing, analytics, and visualization.

We aim to be an accessible, community-driven conference, with tutorials for novices, advanced topical workshops for practitioners, and opportunities for package developers and users to meet in person.

entry.title: Diving into Open Data with IPython Notebook & pandas
entry.summary:
Summary

I'll walk you through Python's best tools for getting a grip on some new open data: IPython Notebook and pandas. I'll show you how to read in data, clean it up, graph it, and draw some conclusions, using some open data about the number of cyclists on Montréal's bike paths as an example.

entry.title: Diving into Open Data with IPython Notebook & Pandas
entry.summary:
Summary

I'll walk you through Python's best tools for getting a grip on data: IPython Notebook and pandas. I'll show you how to read in data, clean it up, graph it, and draw some conclusions, using some open data about the number of cyclists on Montréal's bike paths as an example.
